info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud CX Sales - Service Request Credit Details
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Sales and Service â€” Service Request Credit Details module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Service Request Credit Details

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description: (Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

item.name: Gets a collection of credit details

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AdjustmentComments; string; The reason for the adjustment.
  • AdjustmentReason; string; The reason for the adjustment.
  • AdjustmentStatus; string; The adjustment status.
  • AreaCode; string; The area code.
  • BillToAddressId; number; The unique identifier of the billing address.
  • BillToContactId; number; The unique identifier of the billing point of contact.
  • BookedDate; string; The date when the order got booked.
  • BusinessUnitName; string; The name of the business unit.
  • CalcnToFuncCurrencyCnvrt; number; The rate used to convert credit amount from calculation currency to functional currency. This column will be populated while creating record from credit UI.
  • CalcnToHomeCurrencyCnvrt; number; The rate used to convert credit amount from calculation currency to home currency.
  • CalcnToSourceCurrencyCnvrt; number; The rate used to convert amount from calculation currency to source currency. This will be populated during credit adjustment on UI.
  • CalculationCurrencyCode; string; The participant's calculation currency code.
  • City; string; The name of the city.
  • Country; string; The name of the country.
  • CrdAmountCalcnCurrency; number; The credit amount in the calculation currency.
  • CrdAmountFunctCurrency; number; The credit amount in the functional currency.
  • CrdAmountHomeCurrency; number; The credit amount in the home currency.
  • CrdAmountSourceCurrency; number; The credit amount in the source currency.
  • CreditDate; string; The date based on which the crediting rule is determined.
  • CreditId; integer; Generated from the sequence.
  • CreditStatusMeaning; string; The status of the credit.
  • CreditType; string; The possible values are direct, indirect, and summarized.
  • CreditTypeMeaning; string; The credit type name.
  • CreditedParticipantName; string; The name of the participant who's receiving credit.
  • CustomerId; number; The unique identifier for the customer.
  • DirectParticipantId; integer; The participant identifier of the direct credit receiver.
  • EligibleCatId; integer; The eligible category populated during classification.
  • EligibleCreditCategory; string; The name of the credit category.
  • HoldFlag; boolean; Transaction won't be considered for further processing if the flag is set to Y.
  • HomeCurrencyCode; string; The participant's home currency code.
  • InventoryItemId; number; The unique identifier for the item.
  • InvoiceDate; string; The invoice date.
  • InvoiceNumber; string; The unique identifier for the invoice.
  • ObjectStatus; string; The status of the transaction.
  • OrderNumber; string; The unique identifier for the order.
  • OrgId; integer; Indicates the identifier of the business unit associated to the row.
  • ParticipantId; integer; The unique identifier for the sales rep of the transaction.
  • PartyId; integer; The unique party identifier of the participant.
  • PostalCode; string; The postal code.
  • PreserveCreditFlag; boolean; Flag to indicate if the corresponding credit was adjusted.
  • Province; string; The name of the province.
  • ReasonCode; string; The reason for the adjustment.
  • RevenueType; string; The possible values are revenue, nonrevenue, and custom revenue type.
  • RollupDate; string; The date based on which rollup hierarchy is determined.
  • SalesChannel; string; The sales channel.
  • ShipToAddressId; number; The unique identifier of the shipping address.
  • ShipToContactId; number; The unique identifier of the shipping point of contact.
  • SourceCurrencyCode; string; The currency code in which the source amounts are specified.
  • SourceEventDate; string; The date on which the transaction was processed in the source system.
  • SourceEventPeriodId; integer; The period ID of the source event date.
  • SourceSystemId; string; The unique identifier from the source system.
  • SourceToCalcnCurrencyCnvrt; number; Rate used to convert credit amount from source currency to calculation currency. This is populated while creating the credits in the crediting process.
  • SourceToFuncCurrencyCnvrt; number; Rate used to convert credit amount from source currency to functional currency. This column is populated while creating record by the crediting process.
  • SourceToHomeCurrencyCnvrt; number; Rate used to convert credit amount from source currency to participant's home currency. This column is populated while creating record from the crediting process.
  • SourceTrxNumber; string; The user-friendly unique identifier of the transaction.
  • SplitPct; number; The split percentage.
  • State; string; The name of the state.
  • TransactionId; integer; Generated from sequence.
  • TransactionQuantity; number; The quantity of the unit sold in the transaction.
  • TransactionType; string; The transaction type attribute identifying the source of the transaction.
  • TransactionTypeMeaning; string; The transaction type meaning identifying the source of the transaction.
  • TrnsAmountCalcnCurrency; number; The transaction amount in the calculation currency.
  • TrnsAmountFunctCurrency; number; The transaction amount in the functional currency.
  • TrnsAmountHomeCurrency; number; The transaction amount in the home currency.
  • TrnsAmountSourceCurrency; number; The transaction amount in the source currency.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds a credit detail based on the primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • CreditId; integer; The unique identifier assigned to the credit.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds a credit detail based on the primary key.
    Finder Variables

item.description: The service request credit details service provides credit details for use in population of service request tickets.
